member.summary: Determines whether the package contains a metadata property with the specified name.

member.returns: True if the package contains a property with the specified name; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.MetadataPackage.FindProperties(GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.Func{GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.MetadataProperty,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Finds the metadata properties satisfying the specified predicate. The search is recursive so it affects all nested packages as well.
member.param: A function to test each metadata property for a condition.
member.returns: An that contains properties from the package that satisfy the condition.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.MetadataPackage.UpdateProperties(GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.Func{GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.MetadataProperty,System.Boolean},GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.PropertyValue)
member.summary: Updates known metadata properties satisfying the specified predicate. The operation is recursive so it affects all nested packages as well.
member.param: A function to test each metadata property for a condition.
A new value for the filtered properties.
member.returns: The number of affected properties.
member.remarks: Please note that GroupDocs.Metadata implicitly checks the type of each filtered property. It's impossible to update a property with a value having inappropriate type.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.MetadataPackage.RemoveProperties(GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.Func{GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.MetadataProperty,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Removes metadata properties satisfying the specified predicate.
member.param: A function to test each metadata property for a condition.
member.returns: The number of affected properties.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.MetadataPackage.AddProperties(GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.Func{GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.MetadataProperty,System.Boolean},GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.PropertyValue)
member.summary: Adds known metadata properties satisfying the specified predicate. The operation is recursive so it affects all nested packages as well.
member.param: A function to test each metadata property for a condition.
A value for the picked properties.
member.returns: The number of affected properties.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.MetadataPackage.SetProperties(GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.Func{GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.MetadataProperty,System.Boolean},GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.PropertyValue)
member.summary: Sets known metadata properties satisfying the specified predicate. The operation is recursive so it affects all nested packages as well. This method is a combination of and . If an existing property satisfies the predicate its value is updated. If there is a known property missing in the package that satisfies the predicate it is added to the package.
member.param: A function to test each metadata property for a condition.
A new value for the filtered properties.
member.returns: The number of affected properties.
member.remarks: Please note that GroupDocs.Metadata implicitly checks the type of each filtered property. It's impossible to set a property with a value having inappropriate type.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.MetadataPackage.Sanitize
member.summary: Removes writable metadata properties from the package. The operation is recursive so it affects all nested packages as well.
member.returns: The number of affected properties.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Archive.ZipFile.Flags
member.summary: Gets the ZIP entry flags.

remarks.para:
Bit 00: encrypted file.
Bit 01: compression option.
Bit 02: compression option.
Bit 03: data descriptor.
Bit 04: enhanced deflation.
Bit 05: compressed patched data.
Bit 06: strong encryption.
Bit 07-10: unused.
Bit 11: language encoding.
Bit 12: reserved.
Bit 13: mask header values.
Bit 14-15: reserved.

member.value: The entry name. It can be a file or directory name.

member.value: An array of bytes representing the name of the entry.

member.summary: Gets or sets the album. Maximum length is 30 characters.

member.summary: Gets or sets the title.

member.summary: Gets or sets the track number. Presented in a ID3v1.1 tag only.
member.remarks: If the value of is a positive integer then ID3 changes version to 'ID3v1.1' automatically.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Creates a list from the package.

member.summary: Removes all attached pictures stored in APIC frames.

member.summary: Removes the specified frame from the tag.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.Version
member.summary: Gets the ID3 version.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.TagSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the tag.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.Album
member.summary: Gets or sets the Album/Movie/Show title. This value is represented by the TALB frame.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.Artist
member.summary: Gets or sets the Lead artist(s)/Lead performer(s)/Soloist(s)/Performing group. This value is represented by the TPE1 frame.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.Band
member.summary: Gets or sets the Band/Orchestra/Accompaniment. This value is represented by the TPE2 frame.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.BitsPerMinute
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of beats per minute in the main part of the audio. This value is represented by the TBPM frame.
member.value: The number of beats per minute in the main part of the audio.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.Composers
member.summary: Gets or sets the composers. The names are separated with the "/" character. This value is represented by the TCOM frame.
member.value: The composers. The names are separated with the "/" character.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets the content type. This value is represented by the TCON frame.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.Copyright
member.summary: Gets or sets the copyright message. This value is represented by the TCOP frame.
member.remarks: Every time this field is displayed the field must be preceded with "Copyright © ".

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets a numeric string in the DDMM format containing the date for the recording. This field is always four characters long. This value is represented by the TDAT frame.
member.value: A numeric string in the DDMM format containing the date for the recording.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.EncodedBy
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the person or organization that encoded the audio file. This value is represented by the TENC frame.
member.value: The name of the person or organization that encoded the audio file.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.Publisher
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the label or publisher. This value is represented by the TPUB frame.
member.value: The name of the label or publisher.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.Time
member.summary: Gets or sets a numeric string in the HHMM format containing the time for the recording. This field is always four characters long. This value is represented by the TIME frame.
member.value: A numeric string in the HHMM format containing the time for the recording.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the Title/Song name/Content description. This value is represented by the TIT2 frame.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.Subtitle
member.summary: Gets or sets the Subtitle/Description refinement. This value is represented by the TIT3 frame.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.MusicalKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the musical key in which the sound starts. This value is represented by the TKEY frame.
member.value: The musical key in which the sound starts.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.LengthInMilliseconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the audio file in milliseconds, represented as a numeric string. This value is represented by the TLEN frame.
member.value: The length of the audio file in milliseconds, represented as a numeric string.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.OriginalAlbum
member.summary: Gets or sets the original album/movie/show title. This value is represented by the TOAL frame.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.TrackNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets a numeric string containing the order number of the audio-file on its original recording. This value is represented by the TRCK frame.
member.value: A numeric string containing the order number of the audio-file on its original recording

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.SizeInBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the audio file in bytes, excluding the ID3v2 tag, represented as a numeric string. This value is represented by the TSIZ frame.
member.value: The size of the audio file in bytes, excluding the ID3v2 tag, represented as a numeric string.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.Isrc
member.summary: Gets or sets the International Standard Recording Code (ISRC) (12 characters). This value is represented by the TSRC frame.
member.value: The International Standard Recording Code (ISRC) (12 characters).

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.SoftwareHardware
member.summary: Gets or sets the used audio encoder and its settings when the file was encoded. This value is represented by the TSSE frame.
member.value: The used audio encoder and its settings when the file was encoded.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.Year
member.summary: Gets or sets a numeric string with a year of the recording. This frames is always four characters long (until the year 10000). This value is represented by the TYER frame.
member.value: A numeric string with a year of the recording. This frames is always four characters long (until the year 10000).

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.Comments
member.summary: Gets or sets the user comments. This value is represented by the COMM frame. The frame is intended for any kind of full text information that does not fit in any other frame.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.AttachedPictures
member.summary: Gets or sets the attached pictures directly related to the audio file. This value is represented by the APIC frame.
member.value: The attached pictures directly related to the audio file.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2Tag.TrackPlayCounter
member.summary: Gets the number of times the file has been played. This value is represented by the PCNT frame.
member.value: The number of times a file has been played.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2TagFrameFlags
member.summary: Represents flags used in a ID3v2 tag frame.

member.summary: Indicates whether the current object is equal to another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this object.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is equal to this instance.
member.param: The to compare with this instance.
member.returns: true if the specified is equal to this instance; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2TagFrameFlags.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns a hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A hash code for this instance, suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2TagFrameFlags.TagAlterPreservation
member.summary: Gets the flag that tells the software what to do with this frame if it is unknown and the tag is altered in any way. This applies to all kinds of alterations, including adding more padding and reordering the frames.
member.value: The flag that tells the software what to do with this frame if it is unknown and the tag is altered in any way.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2TagFrameFlags.FileAlterPreservation
member.summary: Gets the flag that tells the software what to do with this frame if it is unknown and the file, excluding the tag, is altered. This does not apply when the audio is completely replaced with other audio data.
member.value: Gets the flag that tells the software what to do with this frame if it is unknown and the file, excluding the tag, is altered.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2TagFrameFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: Gets the tag that tells the software that the contents of this frame is intended to be read-only.
member.value: The tag that tells the software that the contents of this frame is intended to be read-only.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2TagFrameFlags.Compression
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the frame is compressed.
member.value: true, if the frame is compressed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2TagFrameFlags.Encryption
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the frame is encrypted. If set one byte indicating with which method it was encrypted will be appended to the frame header.
member.value: true, if the frame is encrypted; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2TagFrameFlags.GroupingIdentity
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the frame belongs to a group of frames. If set a group identifier byte is added to the frame header. Every frame with the same group identifier belongs to the same group.
member.value: true, if the frame belongs to a group of frames; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2TagFrameFlags.Unsynchronisation
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether unsynchronisation was applied to this frame.
member.value: true, if unsynchronisation was applied to this frame; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.ID3V2TagFrameFlags.DataLengthIndicator
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a data length indicator has been added to the frame. The data length indicator is the value one would write as the 'Frame length' if all of the frame format flags were zeroed, represented as a 32 bit synchsafe integer.
member.value: true, if a data length indicator has been added to the frame; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.LyricsTag
member.summary: Represents Lyrics3 v2.00 metadata. Please find more information at http://id3.org/Lyrics3v2.
member.remarks: Lyrics3 v2.00 uses fields to represent information. The data in a field can consist of ASCII characters in the range 01 to 254 according to the standard. As the ASCII character map is only defined from 00 to 128 ISO-8859-1 might be assumed. Numerical fields are 5 or 6 characters long, depending on location, and are padded with zeroes.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.LyricsTag.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.LyricsTag.Set(GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.LyricsField)
member.summary: Adds or replaces the specified Lyrics3 field.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.LyricsTag.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the field with the specified id.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.LyricsTag.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the field with the specified id.
member.returns: The value if the tag contains a field with the specified id; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.LyricsTag.ToList
member.summary: Creates a list from the package.
member.returns: A list of all fields contained in the Lyrics3 tag.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.LyricsTag.Lyrics
member.summary: Gets or sets the lyrics. This value is represented by the LYR field.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.LyricsTag.AdditionalInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the additional information. This value is represented by the INF field.
member.remarks: This is always three (3) characters long in v2.00, but might be longer in a future standard. The first byte indicates weather or not a lyrics field is present. "1" for present and "0" for otherwise. The second character indicates if there is a timestamp in the lyrics. Again "1" for yes and "0" for no. The third character inhibits tracks for random selection - "1" if inhibited and "0" if not.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.LyricsTag.Author
member.summary: Gets or sets the author. This value is represented by the AUT field.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.LyricsTag.Album
member.summary: Gets or sets the album name. This value is represented by the EAL field.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.LyricsTag.Artist
member.summary: Gets or sets the artist name. This value is represented by the EAR field.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Audio.LyricsTag.Track
member.summary: Gets or sets the track title. This value is represented by the ETT field.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights
member.summary: Indicates font embedding licensing rights for the font.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights.None
member.summary: The undefined licensing rights.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights.UsagePermissionsMask
member.summary: Usage permissions mask.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights.InstallableEmbedding
member.summary: Installable embedding. The font may be embedded, and may be permanently installed for use on a remote systems, or for use by other users.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights.RestrictedLicenseEmbedding
member.summary: Restricted License embedding. The font must not be modified, embedded or exchanged in any manner without first obtaining explicit permission of the legal owner.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights.PreviewAndPrintEmbedding
member.summary: Preview and Print embedding. The font may be embedded, and may be temporarily loaded on other systems for purposes of viewing or printing the document. Documents containing Preview & Print fonts must be opened “read-only”; no edits can be applied to the document.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights.EditableEmbedding
member.summary: Editable embedding. The font may be embedded, and may be temporarily loaded on other systems. As with Preview and Print embedding, documents containing Editable fonts may be opened for reading. In addition, editing is permitted, including ability to format new text using the embedded font, and changes may be saved.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights.NoSubsetting
member.summary: No subsetting. When this bit is set, the font may not be subsetted prior to embedding. Other embedding restrictions specified in bits 0 to 3 and bit 9 also apply.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights.BitmapEmbeddingOnly
member.summary: Bitmap embedding only. When this bit is set, only bitmaps contained in the font may be embedded. No outline data may be embedded. If there are no bitmaps available in the font, then the font is considered unembeddable and the embedding services will fail. Other embedding restrictions specified in bits 0-3 and 8 also apply.

summary.para:
Represents a Photoshop Image Resource block.
Image resource blocks are the basic building unit of several file formats, including Photoshop's native file format, JPEG, and TIFF. Image resources are used to store non-pixel data associated with images, such as pen tool paths.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceBlock.Signature
member.summary: Gets the image resource block signature.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceBlock.ID
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for the resource.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceBlock.Name
member.summary: Gets the image resource block name.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceBlock.Data
member.summary: Gets the resource data.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID
member.summary: Image resources standard ID numbers. Not all file formats use all ID's. Some information may be stored in other sections of the file.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.ResolutionInfo
member.summary: ResolutionInfo structure. See Appendix A in Photoshop API Guide PDF document.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.NamesOfAlphaChannels
member.summary: Names of the alpha channels as a series of Pascal strings.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.Caption
member.summary: The caption as a Pascal string.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.BorderInformation
member.summary: Border information. Contains a fixed number (2 bytes real, 2 bytes fraction) for the border width, and 2 bytes for border units (1 = inches, 2 = cm, 3 = points, 4 = picas, 5 = columns).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Background color. See more.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.PrintFlags
member.summary: Print flags. A series of one-byte boolean values (see Page Setup dialog): labels, crop marks, color bars, registration marks, negative, flip, interpolate, caption, print flags.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.Grayscale
member.summary: Grayscale and multichannel halftoning information.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.ColorHalftoning
member.summary: Color halftoning information.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.DuotoneHalftoning
member.summary: Duotone halftoning information.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.GrayscaleFunction
member.summary: Grayscale and multichannel transfer function.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.ColorTransferFunctions
member.summary: Color transfer functions.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.DuotoneTransferFunctions
member.summary: Duotone transfer functions.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.DuotoneImageInformation
member.summary: Duotone image information.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.EPSOptions
member.summary: EPS options.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.QuickMaskInformation
member.summary: Quick Mask information. 2 bytes containing Quick Mask channel ID; 1- byte boolean indicating whether the mask was initially empty.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.LayerStateInformation
member.summary: Layer state information. 2 bytes containing the index of target layer (0 = bottom layer).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.WorkingPath
member.summary: Working path (not saved). See See Path resource format.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.LayersGroupInformation
member.summary: Layers group information. 2 bytes per layer containing a group ID for the dragging groups. Layers in a group have the same group ID.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.Iptc
member.summary: IPTC-NAA record. Contains the File Info... information. See the documentation in the IPTC folder of the Documentation folder.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.ImageModeForRawFormat
member.summary: Image mode for raw format files.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.JpegQuality
member.summary: JPEG quality. Private.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.GridAndGuidesInfoPhotoshop4
member.summary: Grid and guides information.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.ThumbnailResourcePhotoshop4
member.summary: Thumbnail resource for Photoshop 4.0 only.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.CopyrightFlagPhotoshop4
member.summary: Copyright flag. Boolean indicating whether image is copyrighted. Can be set via Property suite or by user in File Info...

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.UrlPhotoshop4
member.summary: URL. Handle of a text string with uniform resource locator. Can be set via Property suite or by user in File Info...

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.ThumbnailResourcePhotoshop5
member.summary: Thumbnail resource (supersedes resource 1033). See See Thumbnail resource format.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.GlobalAnglePhotoshop5
member.summary: Global Angle. 4 bytes that contain an integer between 0 and 359, which is the global lighting angle for effects layer. If not present, assumed to be 30.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.IccProfilePhotoshop5
member.summary: (Photoshop 5.0) ICC Profile. The raw bytes of an ICC (International Color Consortium) format profile. See ICC1v42_2006-05.pdf in the Documentation folder and icProfileHeader.h in Sample Code\Common\Includes.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.WatermarkPhotoshop5
member.summary: Watermark. One byte.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.IccUntaggedProfilePhotoshop5
member.summary: ICC Untagged Profile. 1 byte that disables any assumed profile handling when opening the file. 1 = intentionally untagged.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.TransparencyIndexPhotoshop6
member.summary: Transparency Index. 2 bytes for the index of transparent color, if any.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.GlobalAltitudePhotoshop6
member.summary: Global Altitude. 4 byte entry for altitude.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.SlicesPhotoshop6
member.summary: Slices (Photoshop 6).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.WorkflowUrlPhotoshop6
member.summary: Workflow URL. Unicode string. Photoshop 6.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.AlphaIdentifiersPhotoshop6
member.summary: Alpha Identifiers. 4 bytes of length, followed by 4 bytes each for every alpha identifier.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.UrlListPhotoshop6
member.summary: URL InternalList. 4 byte count of URLs, followed by 4 byte long, 4 byte ID, and Unicode string for each count.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.VersionInfoPhotoshop6
member.summary: Version Info. 4 bytes version, 1 byte hasRealMergedData , Unicode string: writer name, Unicode string: reader name, 4 bytes file version.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.ExifData1Photoshop7
member.summary: EXIF data 1, see more.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.XmpPhotoshop7
member.summary: XMP metadata. File info as XML description, see more.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.CaptionDigestPhotoshop7
member.summary: Caption digest. 16 bytes: RSA Data Security, MD5 message-digest algorithm.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.PrintScalePhotoshop7
member.summary: Print scale. 2 bytes style (0 = centered, 1 = size to fit, 2 = user defined). 4 bytes x location (floating point). 4 bytes y location (floating point). 4 bytes scale (floating point).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.PixelAspectRatio
member.summary: Pixel Aspect Ratio. 4 bytes (version = 1 or 2), 8 bytes double, x / y of a pixel. Version 2, attempting to correct values for NTSC and PAL, previously off by a factor of approx. 5%.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.LayerComps
member.summary: Layer Comps. 4 bytes (descriptor version = 16), Descriptor.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.LayerSelectionIds
member.summary: Layer Selection ID(s). 2 bytes count, following is repeated for each count: 4 bytes layer ID.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.PrintInfoCS2
member.summary: Print info (Photoshop CS2).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.LayerGroupEnabledIdCS2
member.summary: Layer Group(s) Enabled ID. 1 byte for each layer in the document, repeated by length of the resource. NOTE: Layer groups have start and end markers (Photoshop CS2).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.ColorSamplersResourceCS3
member.summary: Color samplers resource. Also see ID 1038 for old format.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.MeasurementScaleCS3
member.summary: Measurement Scale. 4 bytes (descriptor version = 16), Descriptor.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.TimelineInformationCS3
member.summary: Timeline Information. 4 bytes (descriptor version = 16), Descriptor.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.SheetDisclosureCS3
member.summary: Sheet Disclosure. 4 bytes (descriptor version = 16), Descriptor.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.PrintInformationCS5
member.summary: Print Information (Photoshop CS5).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.PrintStyleCS5
member.summary: Print Style (Photoshop CS5).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.MacintoshNSPrintInfoCS5
member.summary: Macintosh NSPrintInfo. Variable OS specific info for Macintosh. NSPrintInfo. It is recommended that you do not interpret or use this data. (Photoshop CS5).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.WindowsDevmodeCS5
member.summary: Windows DEVMODE. Variable OS specific info for Windows. DEVMODE. It is recommended that you do not interpret or use this data. (Photoshop CS5).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.AutoSaveFilePathCS6
member.summary: Auto Save File Path. Unicode string. (Photoshop CS6).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.AutoSaveFormatCS6
member.summary: Auto Save Format. Unicode string. (Photoshop CS6).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.PathSelectionStateCC
member.summary: Path Selection State. (Photoshop CC).

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.ImageReadyVariables
member.summary: Image Ready variables. XML representation of variables definition.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.ImageReadyDatasets
member.summary: Image Ready data sets.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.ImageResourceID.PrintFlagsInformation
member.summary: Print flags information. 2 bytes version ( = 1), 1 byte center crop marks, 1 byte ( = 0), 4 bytes bleed width value, 2 bytes bleed width scale.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.PsdCompressionMethod
member.summary: Defines the compression method used for image data.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.PsdCompressionMethod.Raw
member.summary: No compression. The image data stored as raw bytes in RGBA planar order. That means that first all R data is written, then all G is written, then all B and finally all A data is written.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.PsdCompressionMethod.Rle
member.summary: RLE compressed. The image data starts with the byte counts for all the scan lines (rows * channels), with each count stored as a two-byte value. The RLE compressed data follows, with each scan line compressed separately. The RLE compression is the same compression algorithm used by the Macintosh ROM routine PackBits and the TIFF standard.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.PsdCompressionMethod.ZipWithoutPrediction
member.summary: ZIP without prediction.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.PsdCompressionMethod.ZipWithPrediction
member.summary: ZIP with prediction.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader
member.summary: Represents the AVIMAINHEADER structure in an AVI video.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.MicroSecPerFrame
member.summary: Gets the the number of microseconds between frames. This value indicates the overall timing for the file.
member.value: The number of microseconds between frames.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.MaxBytesPerSec

summary.para:
Gets the approximate maximum data rate of the file.
This value indicates the number of bytes per second the system must handle to present an AVI sequence as specified by the other parameters contained in the main header and stream header chunks.

member.value: The the approximate maximum data rate of the file.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.PaddingGranularity
member.summary: Gets the alignment for data, in bytes. Pad the data to multiples of this value.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.AviHeaderFlags
member.summary: Gets a bitwise combination of zero or more of the AVI flags.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.TotalFrames
member.summary: Gets the the total number of frames of data in the file.

summary.para:
Gets the initial frame for interleaved files.
Noninterleaved files should specify zero. If you are creating interleaved files, specify the number of frames in the file prior to the initial frame of the AVI sequence in this member.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.Streams
member.summary: Gets the number of streams in the file. For example, a file with audio and video has two streams.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.SuggestedBufferSize

summary.para:
Gets the suggested buffer size for reading the file.
Generally, this size should be large enough to contain the largest chunk in the file. If set to zero, or if it is too small, the playback software will have to reallocate memory during playback, which will reduce performance. For an interleaved file, the buffer size should be large enough to read an entire record, and not just a chunk.

member.value: The suggested buffer size for reading the file.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.Width
member.summary: Gets the width of the AVI file in pixels.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeader.Height
member.summary: Gets the height of the AVI file in pixels.

member.summary: Represents AVI Header flags.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeaderFlags.HasIndex
member.summary: Indicates the AVI file has an index.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeaderFlags.MustUseIndex
member.summary: Indicates that application should use the index, rather than the physical ordering of the chunks in the file, to determine the order of presentation of the data. For example, this flag could be used to create a list of frames for editing.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeaderFlags.IsInterleaved
member.summary: Indicates the AVI file is interleaved.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeaderFlags.TrustCkType
member.summary: Use CKType to find key frames.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeaderFlags.WasCaptureFile
member.summary: Indicates the AVI file is a specially allocated file used for capturing real-time video. Applications should warn the user before writing over a file with this flag set because the user probably defragmented this file.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.AviHeaderFlags.Copyrighted
member.summary: Indicates the AVI file contains copyrighted data and software. When this flag is used, software should not permit the data to be duplicated.

member.summary: Gets the track number as used in the Block Header. Using more than 127 tracks is not encouraged, though the design allows an unlimited number.
member.value: The track number as used in the Block Header.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.MatroskaTrack.TrackUid
member.summary: Gets the unique ID to identify the Track. This SHOULD be kept the same when making a direct stream copy of the Track to another file.
member.value: The unique ID to identify the Track.

member.summary: Gets the type of the track.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.MatroskaTrack.FlagEnabled
member.summary: Gets the enabled flag, true if the track is usable.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.MatroskaTrack.DefaultDuration
member.summary: Gets the number of nanoseconds (not scaled via ) per frame.
member.remarks: Note: 'frame' in the Matroska sense -- one Element put into a (Simple)Block.
member.value: The number of nanoseconds (not scaled via ) per frame.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.MatroskaTrack.Name
member.summary: Gets the human-readable track name.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.MatroskaTrack.Language
member.summary: Gets the language of the track in the Matroska languages form. This Element MUST be ignored if the Element is used in the same TrackEntry.
member.remarks: Language codes can be either the 3 letters bibliographic ISO-639-2 form (like "fre" for french), or such a language code followed by a dash and a country code for specialities in languages(like "fre-ca" for Canadian French). Country codes are the same as used for internet domains.
member.value: The language of the track in the Matroska languages form.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Video.MatroskaTrack.LanguageIetf
member.summary: Gets the language of the track according to BCP 47 and using the IANA Language Subtag Registry. If this Element is used, then any Elements used in the same TrackEntry MUST be ignored.
member.value: The language of the track according to BCP 47 and using the IANA Language Subtag Registry.

member.summary: Gets an ID corresponding to the codec.

member.value: An ID corresponding to the codec.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.TransferFunction
member.summary: Describes a transfer function for the image in tabular style. Pixel components can be gamma-compensated, companded, non-uniformly quantized, or coded in some other way. The TransferFunction maps the pixel components from a non-linear BitsPerSample (e.g. 8-bit) form into a 16-bit linear form without a perceptible loss of accuracy.

member.summary: The purpose of the HalftoneHints field is to convey to the halftone function the range of gray levels within a colorimetrically-specified image that should retain tonal detail.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.TileWidth
member.summary: The tile width in pixels. This is the number of columns in each tile.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.TileLength
member.summary: The tile length (height) in pixels. This is the number of rows in each tile.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.TileOffsets
member.summary: For each tile, the byte offset of that tile, as compressed and stored on disk. The offset is specified with respect to the beginning of the TIFF file. Note that this implies that each tile has a location independent of the locations of other tiles.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.TileByteCounts
member.summary: For each tile, the number of (compressed) bytes in that tile.

member.summary: The set of inks used in a separated (PhotometricInterpretation=5) image.

member.summary: The name of each ink used in a separated (PhotometricInterpretation=5) image, written as a list of concatenated, NUL-terminated ASCII strings.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.NumberOfInks
member.summary: The number of inks. Usually equal to SamplesPerPixel, unless there are extra samples.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Formats.Image.TiffTagID.DotRange
member.summary: The component values that correspond to a 0% dot and 100% dot. DotRange[0] corresponds to a 0% dot, and DotRange[1] corresponds to a 100% dot.

member.returns: The number of affected properties.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Metadata.SetProperties(GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.Func{GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.MetadataProperty,System.Boolean},GroupDocs.Metadata.Common.PropertyValue)
member.summary: Sets known metadata properties satisfying the specified predicate. The operation is recursive so it affects all nested packages as well. This method is a combination of and . If an existing property satisfies the predicate its value is updated. If there is a known property missing in the package that satisfies the predicate it is added to the package.
member.param: A function to test each metadata property for a condition.
A new value for the filtered properties.
member.returns: The number of affected properties.
member.remarks: Please note that GroupDocs.Metadata implicitly checks the type of each filtered property. It's impossible to set a property with a value having inappropriate type.

member.returns: The number of affected properties.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage
member.summary: Represents a Dublin Core metadata package.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Contributor
member.summary: Gets the contributor Dublin Core element.
member.value: An entity responsible for making contributions to the content of the resource. Examples of a Contributor include a person, an organization or a service.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Coverage
member.summary: Gets the coverage Dublin Core element.
member.value: The extent or scope of the content of the resource. Coverage will typically include spatial location (a place name or geographic co-ordinates), temporal period (a period label, date, or date range) or jurisdiction (such as a named administrative entity).

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Creator
member.summary: Gets the creator Dublin Core element.
member.value: An entity primarily responsible for making the content of the resource. Examples of a Creator include a person, an organization, or a service.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Date
member.summary: Gets the date Dublin Core element.
member.value: A date associated with an event in the life cycle of the resource. Typically, Date will be associated with the creation or availability of the resource. Recommended best practice for encoding the date value is defined in a profile of ISO 8601 and follows the YYYY-MM-DD format.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Description
member.summary: Gets the description Dublin Core element.
member.value: An account of the content of the resource. Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, table of contents, reference to a graphical representation of content or a free-text account of the content.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Format
member.summary: Gets the format Dublin Core element.
member.value: The physical or digital manifestation of the resource. Typically, Format may include the media-type or dimensions of the resource. Examples of dimensions include size and duration. Format may be used to determine the software, hardware or other equipment needed to display or operate the resource.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Language
member.summary: Gets the language Dublin Core element.
member.value: A language of the intellectual content of the resource. Recommended best practice for the values of the Language element is defined by RFC 3066 which, in conjunction with ISO 639), defines two- and three-letter primary language tags with optional subtags.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Publisher
member.summary: Gets the publisher Dublin Core element.
member.value: The entity responsible for making the resource available. Examples of a Publisher include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Publisher should be used to indicate the entity.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Relation
member.summary: Gets the relation Dublin Core element.
member.value: A reference to a related resource. Recommended best practice is to reference the resource by means of a string or number conforming to a formal identification system.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Source
member.summary: Gets the source Dublin Core element.
member.value: A Reference to a resource from which the present resource is derived. The present resource may be derived from the Source resource in whole or part. Recommended best practice is to reference the resource by means of a string or number conforming to a formal identification system.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Subject
member.summary: Gets the subject Dublin Core element.
member.value: The topic of the content of the resource. Typically, a Subject will be expressed as keywords or key phrases or classification codes that describe the topic of the resource. Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary or formal classification scheme.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Title
member.summary: Gets the title Dublin Core element.
member.value: The name given to the resource. Typically, a Title will be a name by which the resource is formally known.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Type
member.summary: Gets the type Dublin Core element.
member.value: The nature or genre of the content of the resource. Type includes terms describing general categories, functions, genres, or aggregation levels for content. Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary (for example, the DCMIType vocabulary).

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Rights
member.summary: Gets the rights Dublin Core element.
member.value: Information about rights held in and over the resource. Typically a Rights element will contain a rights management statement for the resource, or reference a service providing such information. Rights information often encompasses Intellectual Property Rights (IPR), Copyright, and various Property Rights. If the rights element is absent, no assumptions can be made about the status of these and other rights with respect to the resource.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.DublinCore.DublinCorePackage.Identifier
member.summary: Gets the identifier Dublin Core element.
member.value: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context. Recommended best practice is to identify the resource by means of a string or number conforming to a formal identification system.

member.summary: The namespace contains functionality intended to read DublinCore metadata from files of different formats.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Exif.ExifGpsPackage.AltitudeRef

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Iptc.IptcApplicationRecordDataSet.ReleaseDate
member.summary: Designates in the form CCYYMMDD the earliest date the provider intends the object to be used. Follows ISO 8601 standard.
member.example: "19890317" indicates data for release on 17 March 1989.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Iptc.IptcApplicationRecordDataSet.ReleaseTime
member.summary: Designates in the form HHMMSS±HHMM the earliest time the provider intends the object to be used. Follows ISO 8601 standard.
member.example: "090000-0500" indicates object for use after 0900 in New York (five hours behind UTC)

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Iptc.IptcApplicationRecordDataSet.ExpirationDate
member.summary: Designates in the form CCYYMMDD the latest date the provider or owner intends the objectdata to be used. Follows ISO 8601 standard.
member.example: Value '19940317' indicates an objectdata that should not be used after 17 March 1994.

member.summary: Represented in the form CCYYMMDD to designate the date the intellectual content of the objectdata was created rather than the date of the creation of the physical representation.
member.remarks: Follows ISO 8601 standard. Where the month or day cannot be determined, the information will be represented by “00”. Where the year cannot be determined, the information for century and year will be represented by “00”.
member.example: Value "19900127" indicates the intellectual content created on 27th January 1990.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Iptc.IptcApplicationRecordDataSet.TimeCreated

member.remarks: Follows ISO 8601 standard.
member.example: Value "133015+0100" indicates that the object intellectual content was created at 1:30 p.m. and 15 seconds Frankfurt time, one hour ahead of UTC.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Iptc.IptcEnvelopeRecordDataSet
member.summary: Defines IPTC Envelope Record dataSet numbers.

summary.para:
A binary number identifying the version of the Information
Interchange Model, Part I, utilised by the provider. Version numbers are assigned by IPTC and NAA.
The version number of this record is four (4).

Optional, repeatable, maximum 1024 octets, consisting of sequentially contiguous graphic characters.
This DataSet is to accommodate some providers who require routing information above the appropriate OSI layers.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Iptc.IptcEnvelopeRecordDataSet.FileFormat
member.summary: File format.

summary.para:
Mandatory, not repeatable, two octets.
A binary number representing the particular version of the File Format specified in 1:20.
A list of File Formats, including version cross references, is included as Appendix A.

Mandatory, not repeatable. Up to 10 octets, consisting of graphic characters.
Identifies the provider and product.

Mandatory, not repeatable, eight octets, consisting of numeric characters.
The characters form a number that will be unique for the date specified in 1:70 and for the Service Identifier specified in 1:30.
If identical envelope numbers appear with the same date and with the same Service Identifier, records 2-9 must be unchanged from the original.
This is not intended to be a sequential serial number reception check.

Optional, repeatable. Up to 32 octets, consisting of graphic characters.
Allows a provider to identify subsets of its overall service.
Used to provide receiving organization data on which to select, route, or otherwise handle data.

Optional, not repeatable. A single octet, consisting of a numeric character.
Specifies the envelope handling priority and not the editorial urgency (see 2:10, Urgency). '1' indicates the most urgent, '5' the normal urgency, and '8' the least urgent copy. The numeral '9' indicates a User Defined Priority. The numeral '0' is reserved for future use.

Mandatory, not repeatable. Eight octets, consisting of numeric characters.
Uses the format CCYYMMDD (century, year, month, day) as defined in ISO 8601 to indicate year, month and day the service sent the material.

Uses the format HHMMSS±HHMM where HHMMSS refers to local hour, minute and seconds and HHMM refers to hours and minutes ahead (+) or behind (-) Universal Coordinated Time as described in ISO 8601. This is the time the service sent the material.

Optional, not repeatable, up to 32 octets, consisting of one or more control functions used for the announcement, invocation or designation of coded character sets. The control functions follow the ISO 2022 standard and may consist of the escape control character and one or more graphic characters. For more details see Appendix C, the IPTC-NAA Code Library.

member.summary: Binary number representing the particular version of the ARM specified in DataSet 1:120.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Xmp.Schemes.XmpIptcCorePackage.SubjectCodes

member.remarks: More about IPTC Subject-NewsCodes at http://www.newscodes.org.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Xmp.Schemes.XmpDynamicMediaPackage.CameraAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the camera to the subject in a static shot, from a fixed set of industry standard terminology.
member.value: The orientation of the camera to the subject in a static shot, from a fixed set of industry standard terminology. Predefined values include: Low Angle, Eye Level, High Angle, Overhead Shot, Birds Eye Shot, Dutch Angle, POV, Over the Shoulder, Reaction Shot.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Xmp.Schemes.XmpDynamicMediaPackage.CameraLabel
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of the camera used for a shoot.
member.value: The description of the camera used for a shoot. Can be any string, but is usually simply a number, for example "1", "2", or more explicitly "Camera 1".

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Xmp.Schemes.XmpDynamicMediaPackage.CameraModel

member.value: The make and model of the camera used for a shoot.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Standards.Xmp.Schemes.XmpDynamicMediaPackage.CameraMove
member.summary: Gets or sets the movement of the camera during the shot, from a fixed set of industry standard terminology.
member.value: The movement of the camera during the shot, from a fixed set of industry standard terminology. Predefined values include: Aerial, Boom Up, Boom Down, Crane Up, Crane Down, Dolly In, Dolly Out, Pan Left, Pan Right, Pedestal Up, Pedestal Down, Tilt Up, Tilt Down, Tracking, Truck Left, Truck Right, Zoom In, Zoom Out.

summary.para: Represents XMP Language Alternative.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Tagging.PersonTagCategory
member.summary: Provides tags that mark metadata properties holding information about the people contributed to file or intellectual content creation. These tags can help you to find the document creator, editor or even the client for whom the work was performed. Despite the name of the category some metadata properties marked with the tags can contain a company name rather than a person's name.

members.member:
Gets the tag that labels a property containing the name of a person who somehow contributed to file creation. Please note that the tag is not applied towards metadata properties marked with more specific tags from this category. E.g. if a property labeled with the Creator tag.
The tag that labels a property containing the name of a person who somehow contributed to file creation. .

member.summary: Gets the language of the track in the Matroska languages form. This Element MUST be ignored if the Element is used in the same TrackEntry.
member.remarks: Language codes can be either the 3 letters bibliographic ISO-639-2 form (like "fre" for french), or such a language code followed by a dash and a country code for specialities in languages(like "fre-ca" for Canadian French). Country codes are the same as used for internet domains.
member.value: The language of the track in the Matroska languages form.

member.summary: Gets the language of the track according to BCP 47 and using the IANA Language Subtag Registry. If this Element is used, then any Elements used in the same TrackEntry MUST be ignored.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights
member.summary: Indicates font embedding licensing rights for the font.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights.None
member.summary: The undefined licensing rights.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights.UsagePermissionsMask
member.summary: Usage permissions mask.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights.InstallableEmbedding
member.summary: Installable embedding. The font may be embedded, and may be permanently installed for use on a remote systems, or for use by other users.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights.RestrictedLicenseEmbedding
member.summary: Restricted License embedding. The font must not be modified, embedded or exchanged in any manner without first obtaining explicit permission of the legal owner.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights.PreviewAndPrintEmbedding
member.summary: Preview and Print embedding. The font may be embedded, and may be temporarily loaded on other systems for purposes of viewing or printing the document. Documents containing Preview & Print fonts must be opened “read-only”; no edits can be applied to the document.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights.EditableEmbedding
member.summary: Editable embedding. The font may be embedded, and may be temporarily loaded on other systems. As with Preview and Print embedding, documents containing Editable fonts may be opened for reading. In addition, editing is permitted, including ability to format new text using the embedded font, and changes may be saved.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights.NoSubsetting
member.summary: No subsetting. When this bit is set, the font may not be subsetted prior to embedding. Other embedding restrictions specified in bits 0 to 3 and bit 9 also apply.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Font.OpenTypeLicensingRights.BitmapEmbeddingOnly
member.summary: Bitmap embedding only. When this bit is set, only bitmaps contained in the font may be embedded. No outline data may be embedded. If there are no bitmaps available in the font, then the font is considered unembeddable and the embedding services will fail. Other embedding restrictions specified in bits 0-3 and 8 also apply.

In this example, an attempt will be made to set metered public and private key
[C#]
Metered matered = new Metered(); matered.SetMeteredKey("PublicKey", "PrivateKey");
[Visual Basic]
Dim matered As Metered = New Metered matered.SetMeteredKey("PublicKey", "PrivateKey")

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.TagFrameFlags.TagAlterPreservation
member.summary: This flag tells the software what to do with this frame if it is unknown and the tag is altered in any way. This applies to all kinds of alterations, including adding more padding and reordering the frames.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.TagFrameFlags.FileAlterPreservation
member.summary: This flag tells the software what to do with this frame if it is unknown and the file, excluding the tag, is altered. This does not apply when the audio is completely replaced with other audio data.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.TagFrameFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: This flag, if set, tells the software that the contents of this frame is intended to be read only.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.TagFrameFlags.Compression
member.summary: This flag indicates whether or not the frame is compressed.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.TagFrameFlags.Encryption
member.summary: This flag indicates wether or not the frame is enrypted. If set one byte indicating with which method it was encrypted will be appended to the frame header. See section 4.26. for more information about encryption method registration.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.TagFrameFlags.GroupingIdentity
member.summary: This flag indicates whether or not this frame belongs in a group with other frames. If set a group identifier byte is added to the frame header. Every frame with the same group identifier belongs to the same group.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.TagFrameFlags.Unsynchronisation
member.summary: This flag indicates whether or not unsynchronisation was applied to this frame.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.TagFrameFlags.DataLengthIndicator
member.summary: This flag indicates that a data length indicator has been added to the frame. The data length indicator is the value one would write as the 'Frame length' if all of the frame format flags were zeroed, represented as a 32 bit synchsafe integer.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.Lyrics3Tag
member.summary: Represents Lyrics3 v2.00 metadata. Please find more information at http://id3.org/Lyrics3v2.
member.remarks: Lyrics3 v2.00 uses fields to represent information. The data in a field can consist of ASCII characters in the range 01 to 254 according to the standard. As the ASCII character map is only defined from 00 to 128 ISO-8859-1 might be assumed. Numerical fields are 5 or 6 characters long, depending on location, and are padded with zeroes.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.Lyrics3Tag.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.Lyrics3Tag.Lyrics
member.summary: Gets or sets the lyrics. Defined tag - LYR.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.Lyrics3Tag.AdditionalInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the additional information. Defined tag - INF.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.Lyrics3Tag.Author
member.summary: Gets or sets the author. Defined tag - AUT.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.Lyrics3Tag.Album
member.summary: Gets or sets the album name. Defined tag - EAL.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.Lyrics3Tag.Artist
member.summary: Gets or sets the artist name. Defined tag - EAR.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.Lyrics3Tag.Track
member.summary: Gets or sets the track title. Defined tag - ETT.

summary.para:
Gets or sets an array of the fields.
There are no required fields in the tag, but at least one field must exist.
Fields can appear in any order in the tag, except the indication (IND) field which must be the first field if used. Fields that include more then one line uses [CR][LF] delimiters between lines.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Audio.Lyrics3Tag.Keys
member.summary: Gets an array of available metadata keys. Keys related to null values are skipped.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Video.AviHeader.MicroSecPerFrame
member.summary: Gets the the number of microseconds between frames. This value indicates the overall timing for the file.
member.value: The number of microseconds between frames.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Video.AviHeader.MaxBytesPerSec

summary.para:
Gets the approximate maximum data rate of the file.
This value indicates the number of bytes per second the system must handle to present an AVI sequence as specified by the other parameters contained in the main header and stream header chunks.

member.value: The the approximate maximum data rate of the file.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Video.AviHeader.PaddingGranularity
member.summary: Gets the alignment for data, in bytes. Pad the data to multiples of this value.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Video.AviHeader.Flags
member.summary: Gets a bitwise combination of zero or more of the AVI flags.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Video.AviHeader.AviHeaderFlags
member.summary: Gets a bitwise combination of zero or more of the AVI flags.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Video.AviHeader.TotalFrames
member.summary: Gets the the total number of frames of data in the file.

summary.para:
Gets the initial frame for interleaved files.
Noninterleaved files should specify zero. If you are creating interleaved files, specify the number of frames in the file prior to the initial frame of the AVI sequence in this member.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Video.AviHeader.Streams
member.summary: Gets the number of streams in the file. For example, a file with audio and video has two streams.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Video.AviHeader.SuggestedBufferSize

summary.para:
Gets the suggested buffer size for reading the file.
Generally, this size should be large enough to contain the largest chunk in the file. If set to zero, or if it is too small, the playback software will have to reallocate memory during playback, which will reduce performance. For an interleaved file, the buffer size should be large enough to read an entire record, and not just a chunk.

member.value: The suggested buffer size for reading the file.

member.summary: Gets the width of the AVI file in pixels.

member.summary: Gets the height of the AVI file in pixels.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.DublinCoreMetadata
member.summary: Represents Dublin Core metadata.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.DublinCoreMetadata.Contributor
member.summary: Gets the contributor Dublin Core element.
member.value: An entity responsible for making contributions to the content of the resource. Examples of a Contributor include a person, an organization or a service.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.DublinCoreMetadata.Coverage
member.summary: Gets the coverage Dublin Core element.
member.value: The extent or scope of the content of the resource. Coverage will typically include spatial location (a place name or geographic co-ordinates), temporal period (a period label, date, or date range) or jurisdiction (such as a named administrative entity).

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.DublinCoreMetadata.Creator
member.summary: Gets the creator Dublin Core element.
member.value: An entity primarily responsible for making the content of the resource. Examples of a Creator include a person, an organization, or a service.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.DublinCoreMetadata.Date
member.summary: Gets the date Dublin Core element.
member.value: A date associated with an event in the life cycle of the resource. Typically, Date will be associated with the creation or availability of the resource. Recommended best practice for encoding the date value is defined in a profile of ISO 8601 and follows the YYYY-MM-DD format.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.DublinCoreMetadata.Description
member.summary: Gets the description Dublin Core element.
member.value: An account of the content of the resource. Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, table of contents, reference to a graphical representation of content or a free-text account of the content.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.DublinCoreMetadata.Format
member.summary: Gets the format Dublin Core element.
member.value: The physical or digital manifestation of the resource. Typically, Format may include the media-type or dimensions of the resource. Examples of dimensions include size and duration. Format may be used to determine the software, hardware or other equipment needed to display or operate the resource.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.DublinCoreMetadata.Language
member.summary: Gets the language Dublin Core element.
member.value: A language of the intellectual content of the resource. Recommended best practice for the values of the Language element is defined by RFC 3066 which, in conjunction with ISO 639), defines two- and three-letter primary language tags with optional subtags.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.DublinCoreMetadata.Publisher
member.summary: Gets the publisher Dublin Core element.
member.value: The entity responsible for making the resource available. Examples of a Publisher include a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Publisher should be used to indicate the entity.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.DublinCoreMetadata.Relation
member.summary: Gets the relation Dublin Core element.
member.value: A reference to a related resource. Recommended best practice is to reference the resource by means of a string or number conforming to a formal identification system.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.DublinCoreMetadata.Source
member.summary: Gets the source Dublin Core element.
member.value: A Reference to a resource from which the present resource is derived. The present resource may be derived from the Source resource in whole or part. Recommended best practice is to reference the resource by means of a string or number conforming to a formal identification system.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.DublinCoreMetadata.Subject
member.summary: Gets the subject Dublin Core element.
member.value: The topic of the content of the resource. Typically, a Subject will be expressed as keywords or key phrases or classification codes that describe the topic of the resource. Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary or formal classification scheme.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.DublinCoreMetadata.Title
member.summary: Gets the title Dublin Core element.
member.value: The name given to the resource. Typically, a Title will be a name by which the resource is formally known.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.DublinCoreMetadata.Type
member.summary: Gets the type Dublin Core element.
member.value: The nature or genre of the content of the resource. Type includes terms describing general categories, functions, genres, or aggregation levels for content. Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary (for example, the DCMIType vocabulary).

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.DublinCoreMetadata.Rights
member.summary: Gets the rights Dublin Core element.
member.value: Information about rights held in and over the resource. Typically a Rights element will contain a rights management statement for the resource, or reference a service providing such information. Rights information often encompasses Intellectual Property Rights (IPR), Copyright, and various Property Rights. If the rights element is absent, no assumptions can be made about the status of these and other rights with respect to the resource.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.DublinCoreMetadata.Identifier
member.summary: Gets the identifier Dublin Core element.
member.value: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context. Recommended best practice is to identify the resource by means of a string or number conforming to a formal identification system.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.ApplicationRecordKeywords.ReleaseDate
member.summary: Designates in the form CCYYMMDD the earliest date the provider intends the object to be used. Follows ISO 8601 standard.
member.example: "19890317" indicates data for release on 17 March 1989.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.ApplicationRecordKeywords.ReleaseTime
member.summary: Designates in the form HHMMSS±HHMM the earliest time the provider intends the object to be used. Follows ISO 8601 standard.
member.example: "090000-0500" indicates object for use after 0900 in New York (five hours behind UTC)

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.ApplicationRecordKeywords.ExpirationDate
member.summary: Designates in the form CCYYMMDD the latest date the provider or owner intends the objectdata to be used. Follows ISO 8601 standard.
member.example: Value '19940317' indicates an objectdata that should not be used after 17 March 1994.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.ApplicationRecordKeywords.DateCreated
member.summary: Represented in the form CCYYMMDD to designate the date the intellectual content of the objectdata was created rather than the date of the creation of the physical representation.
member.remarks: Follows ISO 8601 standard. Where the month or day cannot be determined, the information will be represented by “00”. Where the year cannot be determined, the information for century and year will be represented by “00”.
member.example: Value "19900127" indicates the intellectual content created on 27th January 1990.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.ApplicationRecordKeywords.TimeCreated
member.summary: Represented in the form HHMMSS±HHMM to designate the time the intellectual content of the objectdata current source material was created rather than the creation of the physical representation.
member.remarks: Follows ISO 8601 standard.
member.example: Value "133015+0100" indicates that the object intellectual content was created at 1:30 p.m. and 15 seconds Frankfurt time, one hour ahead of UTC.

member.name: T:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.EnvelopeRecordKeywords
member.summary: Represents IPTC Envelope record.

summary.para:
A binary number identifying the version of the Information
Interchange Model, Part I, utilised by the provider. Version numbers are assigned by IPTC and NAA.
The version number of this record is four (4).

Optional, repeatable, maximum 1024 octets, consisting of sequentially contiguous graphic characters.
This DataSet is to accommodate some providers who require routing information above the appropriate OSI layers.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.EnvelopeRecordKeywords.FileFormat
member.summary: File format.

summary.para:
Mandatory, not repeatable, two octets.
A binary number representing the particular version of the File Format specified in 1:20.
A list of File Formats, including version cross references, is included as Appendix A.

Mandatory, not repeatable. Up to 10 octets, consisting of graphic characters.
Identifies the provider and product.

Mandatory, not repeatable, eight octets, consisting of numeric characters.
The characters form a number that will be unique for the date specified in 1:70 and for the Service Identifier specified in 1:30.
If identical envelope numbers appear with the same date and with the same Service Identifier, records 2-9 must be unchanged from the original.
This is not intended to be a sequential serial number reception check.

Optional, repeatable. Up to 32 octets, consisting of graphic characters.
Allows a provider to identify subsets of its overall service.
Used to provide receiving organization data on which to select, route, or otherwise handle data.

Optional, not repeatable. A single octet, consisting of a numeric character.
Specifies the envelope handling priority and not the editorial urgency (see 2:10, Urgency). '1' indicates the most urgent, '5' the normal urgency, and '8' the least urgent copy. The numeral '9' indicates a User Defined Priority. The numeral '0' is reserved for future use.

Mandatory, not repeatable. Eight octets, consisting of numeric characters.
Uses the format CCYYMMDD (century, year, month, day) as defined in ISO 8601 to indicate year, month and day the service sent the material.

Uses the format HHMMSS±HHMM where HHMMSS refers to local hour, minute and seconds and HHMM refers to hours and minutes ahead (+) or behind (-) Universal Coordinated Time as described in ISO 8601. This is the time the service sent the material.

Optional, not repeatable, up to 32 octets, consisting of one or more control functions used for the announcement, invocation or designation of coded character sets. The control functions follow the ISO 2022 standard and may consist of the escape control character and one or more graphic characters. For more details see Appendix C, the IPTC-NAA Code Library.

summary.para:
Represents Photoshop Image Resource block.
Image resource blocks are the basic building unit of several file formats, including Photoshop's native file format, JPEG, and TIFF. Image resources are used to store non-pixel data associated with images, such as pen tool paths.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.TransferFunction
member.summary: Describes a transfer function for the image in tabular style. Pixel components can be gamma-compensated, companded, non-uniformly quantized, or coded in some other way. The TransferFunction maps the pixel components from a non-linear BitsPerSample (e.g. 8-bit) form into a 16-bit linear form without a perceptible loss of accuracy.

member.summary: Name and version number of the software package(s) used to create the image.

member.summary: Date and time of image creation.

member.summary: Person who created the image.

member.summary: This section defines a Predictor that greatly improves compression ratios for some images.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.WhitePoint
member.summary: The chromaticity of the white point of the image.

member.summary: The chromaticities of the primaries of the image.

member.summary: A color map for palette color images.
