member.summary: The purpose of the HalftoneHints field is to convey to the halftone function the range of gray levels within a colorimetrically-specified image that should retain tonal detail.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.TileWidth
member.summary: The tile width in pixels. This is the number of columns in each tile.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.TileLength
member.summary: The tile length (height) in pixels. This is the number of rows in each tile.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.TileOffsets
member.summary: For each tile, the byte offset of that tile, as compressed and stored on disk. The offset is specified with respect to the beginning of the TIFF file. Note that this implies that each tile has a location independent of the locations of other tiles.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.TileByteCounts
member.summary: For each tile, the number of (compressed) bytes in that tile.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.InkSet
member.summary: The set of inks used in a separated (PhotometricInterpretation=5) image.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.InkNames
member.summary: The name of each ink used in a separated (PhotometricInterpretation=5) image, written as a list of concatenated, NUL-terminated ASCII strings.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.NumberOfInks
member.summary: The number of inks. Usually equal to SamplesPerPixel, unless there are extra samples.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.DotRange
member.summary: The component values that correspond to a 0% dot and 100% dot. DotRange[0] corresponds to a 0% dot, and DotRange[1] corresponds to a 100% dot.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.ExtraSamples
member.summary: Description of extra components.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.SampleFormat
member.summary: This field specifies how to interpret each data sample in a pixel.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.SMinSampleValue
member.summary: This field specifies the minimum sample value.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.SMaxSampleValue
member.summary: This new field specifies the maximum sample value.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.TransferRange
member.summary: Expands the range of the TransferFunction.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.JPEGProc
member.summary: This Field indicates the JPEG process used to produce the compressed data.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.JPEGInterchangeFormat
member.summary: This Field indicates whether a JPEG interchange format bitstream is present in the TIFF file.

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.JPEGInterchangeFormatLength
member.summary: This Field indicates the length in bytes of the JPEG interchange format bitstream

member.name: F:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.TiffTagIdEnum.JPEGRestartInterval
member.summary: This Field indicates the length of the restart interval used in the compressed image data.

member.summary: This Field points to a list of lossless predictor-selection values, one per component.

member.summary: Represents GPS metadata in an EXIF metadata package.

member.name: M:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.Altitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the altitude based on the reference in . The reference unit is meters.
member.value: The altitude based on the reference in .

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.AltitudeRef
member.summary: Gets or set the altitude used as the reference altitude. If the reference is sea level and the altitude is above sea level, 0 is given. If the altitude is below sea level, a value of 1 is given and the altitude is indicated as an absolute value in the tag.
member.value: The altitude used as the reference altitude

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.AreaInformation
member.summary: Gets or sets the character string recording the name of the GPS area. The first byte indicates the character code used, and this is followed by the name of the GPS area.
member.value: The character string recording the name of the GPS area.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.DateStamp
member.summary: Gets or sets the character string recording date and time information relative to UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). The format is YYYY:MM:DD.
member.value: The character string recording date and time information relative to UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). The format is YYYY:MM:DD.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.DestBearing
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS bearing to the destination point. The range of values is from 0.00 to 359.99.
member.value: The bearing to the destination point.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.DestBearingRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS reference used for giving the bearing to the destination point. 'T' denotes true direction and 'M' is magnetic direction.
member.value: The GPS reference used for giving the bearing to the destination point.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.DestDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS distance to the destination point.
member.value: The distance to the destination point.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.DestDistanceRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS unit used to express the distance to the destination point. 'K', 'M' and 'N' represent kilometers, miles and knots.
member.value: The GPS unit used to express the distance to the destination point.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.DestLatitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS latitude of the destination point.
member.value: The latitude of the destination point.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.DestLatitudeRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS value which indicates whether the latitude of the destination point is north or south latitude. The ASCII value 'N' indicates north latitude, and 'S' is south latitude.
member.value: The GPS value which indicates whether the latitude of the destination point is north or south latitude.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.DestLongitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS longitude of the destination point.
member.value: The GPS longitude of the destination point.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.DestLongitudeRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS value which indicates whether the longitude of the destination point is east or west longitude. ASCII 'E' indicates east longitude, and 'W' is west longitude.
member.value: The GPS value which indicates whether the longitude of the destination point is east or west longitude.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.Differential
member.summary: Gets or sets a GPS value which indicates whether differential correction is applied to the GPS receiver.
member.value: A GPS value which indicates whether differential correction is applied to the GPS receiver.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.DataDegreeOfPrecision
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS DOP (data degree of precision). An HDOP value is written during two-dimensional measurement, and PDOP during three-dimensional measurement.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.ImgDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS direction of the image when it was captured. The range of values is from 0.00 to 359.99.
member.value: The GPS direction of the image when it was captured.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.ImgDirectionRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS reference for giving the direction of the image when it is captured. 'T' denotes true direction and 'M' is magnetic direction.
member.value: The GPS reference for giving the direction of the image when it is captured.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.Latitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS latitude.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.LatitudeRef
member.summary: Gets or sets a GPS value indicating whether the latitude is north or south latitude.
member.value: A GPS value indicating whether the latitude is north or south latitude.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.Longitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS longitude.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.LongitudeRef
member.summary: Gets or sets a GPS value indicating whether the longitude is east or west longitude.
member.value: A GPS value indicating whether the longitude is east or west longitude.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.MapDatum
member.summary: Gets or sets the geodetic survey data used by the GPS receiver.
member.value: The geodetic survey data used by the GPS receiver.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.MeasureMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS measurement mode.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.ProcessingMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets a character string recording the name of the method used for location finding. The first byte indicates the character code used, and this is followed by the name of the method.
member.value: A character string recording the name of the method used for location finding.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.Satellites
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPS satellites used for measurements. This tag can be used to describe the number of satellites, their ID number, angle of elevation, azimuth, SNR and other information in ASCII notation. The format is not specified. If the GPS receiver is incapable of taking measurements, value of the tag shall be set to NULL.
member.value: The GPS satellites used for measurements.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.Speed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed of GPS receiver movement.
member.value: The speed of GPS receiver movement.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.SpeedRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit used to express the GPS receiver speed of movement. 'K' 'M' and 'N' represents kilometers per hour, miles per hour, and knots.
member.value: The unit used to express the GPS receiver speed of movement.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.Status
member.summary: Gets or sets the status of the GPS receiver when the image is recorded.
member.value: The status of the GPS receiver when the image is recorded.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Image.GpsInfo.Timestamp

member.summary: Gets the uncompressed size in bytes.

member.name: P:GroupDocs.Metadata.Legacy.Formats.Archive.ZipFileInfo.Flags
member.summary: Gets the ZIP entry flags.

remarks.para:
Bit 00: encrypted file.
Bit 01: compression option.
Bit 02: compression option.
Bit 03: data descriptor.
Bit 04: enhanced deflation.
Bit 05: compressed patched data.
Bit 06: strong encryption.
Bit 07-10: unused.
Bit 11: language encoding.
Bit 12: reserved.
Bit 13: mask header values.
Bit 14-15: reserved.

member.value: The entry name. It can be a file or directory name.

member.summary: Gets an array of bytes representing the name of the entry.

summary.para: Represents XMP Language Alternative.
summary.remarks: An alternative array of simple text items. Language alternatives facilitate the selection of a simple text item based on a desired language. Each array item shall have an xml:lang qualifier. Each xml:lang value shall be unique among the items.

summary.para: Represents XMP Language Alternative.
